name: wl-kbptr
description: Control the mouse pointer with the keyboard on Wayland.
readme_summary: wl-kbptr is a utility that enables users to control the mouse pointer using the keyboard on Wayland. It offers various modes for selecting target areas, including floating, tile, bisect, split, and click, and supports compositors like Sway and Hyprland. It can also use screen capture for automatic target detection.
key_features: Supports multiple modes: floating, tile, bisect, split, click
Supports screen capture for target detection (opencv)
Works with Wayland compositors (Sway, Hyprland, Niri, dwl)
primary_use_case: Control the mouse pointer with the keyboard on Wayland compositors.
cover_image_prompt: Imagine a skilled calligrapher using an ornate keyboard instead of a traditional pen to precisely guide a delicate brush across a digital canvas. The brush paints a smooth, controlled line, mimicking the movement of a mouse cursor. Small, glowing UI elements float around the canvas, displaying keyboard shortcuts and coordinates. The repository name, 'wl-kbptr,' is subtly etched into the keyboard's spacebar. The scene is bathed in soft, ambient light, creating a sense of precision and control. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with rich details and a calming color palette.

name: waydroid
description: Waydroid uses a container-based approach to boot a full Android system on a regular GNU/Linux system like Ubuntu.
readme_summary: Waydroid enables users to run a complete Android system within a container on a GNU/Linux operating system. It leverages Linux namespaces to provide isolation and direct hardware access for the Android environment. The system image is based on LineageOS, allowing users to run Android applications seamlessly on their Linux desktops.
key_features: Container-based approach to run Android on Linux
Direct hardware access for Android system
primary_use_case: Running Android applications on GNU/Linux systems
cover_image_prompt: A skilled architect carefully placing a miniature Android operating system inside a protective, transparent Linux container. The architect uses precision tools and wears a futuristic headset displaying code snippets. The container rests on a platform labeled "GNU/Linux," showcasing compatibility. A holographic projection above the container displays popular Android apps seamlessly running. The scene is set in a clean, brightly lit laboratory with subtle digital particles floating around. Small UI elements on nearby screens show Waydroid's interface. The composition is balanced and focused with a cool color scheme. The image should be in 3D isometric illustration style with rich details and vibrant colors.

name: gmail-tui
description: gmail but in your terminal using go
readme_summary: The gmail-tui repository provides a terminal-based email client for Gmail, written in Go. It allows users to compose, read, and reply to emails directly from their terminal. The project is still under development, focusing on improving functionality and user experience.
primary_use_case: Accessing and managing Gmail through a terminal user interface.
cover_image_prompt: Imagine a cozy, brightly lit train car. A passenger, comfortably seated, is reading emails displayed on a vintage terminal screen built into the train's seat. The train window shows a blurred landscape rushing by, symbolizing the speed and convenience of accessing email from anywhere. A conductor in the background is checking tickets, with one ticket displaying a subtle 'gmail-tui' logo. Small digital particles float around the terminal screen, connecting the vintage interface to modern technology. The scene is rendered in a 3D isometric illustration style with warm colors and a focus on comfort and efficiency.

name: SploitScan
description: SploitScan is a sophisticated cybersecurity utility designed to provide detailed information on vulnerabilities and associated exploits.
readme_summary: SploitScan is a cybersecurity utility designed to streamline the process of identifying exploits for known vulnerabilities. It aggregates data from various sources, including ExploitDB, CISA KEV, and HackerOne, and provides AI-powered risk assessments to help prioritize patching efforts. The tool also supports importing vulnerability scanner results and offers flexible export options.
primary_use_case: Identifying exploits for known vulnerabilities and assessing their exploitation probability.
cover_image_prompt: A seasoned detective in a dimly lit, high-tech office, meticulously examining a complex network of interconnected files and databases. The detective uses a magnifying glass that highlights vulnerabilities and potential exploits within the digital web. Holographic displays around the office show snippets of code, CVE numbers, and threat levels. A large screen in the background displays a world map with hotspots indicating exploited vulnerabilities. The scene is bathed in a cool blue light, creating a sense of urgency and focus. The image should be in a detailed digital painting style with sharp focus and realistic textures, subtly incorporating the SploitScan logo into the detective's badge.

name: awesome-free-apps
description: Curated list of the best free apps for PC and mobile
readme_summary: This repository provides a curated list of free applications for PC and mobile devices, categorized by platform and function. It offers filters to easily find open-source or recommended apps, making it a valuable resource for users seeking free alternatives to paid software.
key_features: Categorized by platform (Windows, macOS, Linux, Android, iOS)
Filters for open-source and recommended apps
Categorized by function (Audio, Browsers, Communication, etc.)
primary_use_case: Discovering free and useful applications for various platforms.
cover_image_prompt: A librarian meticulously organizing a vast collection of applications onto labeled shelves. Each shelf represents a different platform (Windows, macOS, Linux, Android, iOS), clearly marked with corresponding icons. The librarian uses a magnifying glass to inspect each application, ensuring it's free and properly categorized. Digital particles float around the librarian, representing the flow of data and information. Small UI elements on the shelves display app details and download links. The scene is set in a bright, organized library with a warm, inviting atmosphere. The image should be in 3D isometric illustration style with clean lines and vibrant colors.
